column5: Any comments
column10: Any comments
column11: Do you have any other suggestions for sending exam results?

column10: It won't suit every one for all exam sessions, I think that having it "random" actually makes it that some people can see quickly where they stand for the next semester as early as possible. Making them wait to the end of the deadline is actually more stress inducing imo.
column12: Make sure that if times fall differently based on the section, it is based on the course's section, or the course itself, rather than the student, as having students of the same class have grades at different time will be very stress/anxiety inducing.

column5: I like getting grades at a random moment, spices up my holidays
I am generally extremely stressed by my studies (and I can’t identify if I’m stressed more by the way the results are given or by the grade)
column11: I would like a maximum time for the corrections of exams for instance two weeks (especially the ones during the semester). That would help me.

column10: It’s true it can be a source of stress to wait for grades to come one by one, but it can also give an earlier idea of what the final results with be, which is nice
column12: I like the idea of a daily update at a fixed time of the day, it’s true I tend to compulsively refresh the app and is academia many times a day, and night if I happen to wake up

column5: During my bachelor I had nightmares at night due to the stress of waiting for the grades. I didn’t have those nightmares during the exam period which was also stressful. I let you imagine how much stressed I was because of the grades.

Even though I am not stressed about getting my grades cause I am so over EPFL after the exams, I can definitely imagine that a lot of people might feel like they are slowly being roasted in hell whilst waiting for potentially life-changing results.
column12: I think this is a great initiative and could help relieve a lot of completely unnecessary stress for a lot of people. Thank you for your work!!

column5:
It is horrible when you spend good time with some (in particular non EPFL) friends, are showing something on your phone to them, and then they look a bit embarrassed at you and say "ehm I am sorry, I think you have received a grade. It is ok if you want to look at it"
And then you're like yes I want to look but what of it is bad and I start crying ? (Especially true for bachelor year)
column10:
I love the idea of having fixed time for epfl pocket app, cause this is the most stressing one. If you go on isa, you're in a mood where you're ready to face a grade. 

If you dont want the notification from the group chat during vacation, for me is is not a problem to turn them off !
column11: On both (app and isa), that would be great to be able to click on "show" on the different courses. So that, for example, when you are in first year, you can choose to have a look at ICC, but not at Analyse as long as Physics is not out
column12: Thanks for having a careful look at that ! I remembered myself in first semester of bachelor spending sooo much tim just refreshing EPFL app again and again

column10: Pour moi recevoir mes notes a la toute fin, 3 semaines après la fin des exams, me générerait beaucoup plus de stress que la situation actuelle

column5: Je ne comprends pas pourquoi le système n’est pas comme à l’UNIL, où toutes les notes sont communiquées à une date prédéfinie. Cela permettrait de pouvoir profiter de nos vacances avec l’esprit tranquille. Je trouve le système actuel vraiment stressant, particulièrement pour les premières années. Malgré que je sois en 3ème année, cela me stress toujours autant et je passe mes vacances à checker mon téléphone pour voir si j’ai reçu une note. Globalement, j’ai l’impression que cela rend tout le monde nerveux.
column11: Tout recevoir dans un pdf à une date précise serait plus sain pour la santé mentale de chacun.
Should a change be implemented, leave us the option to keep things as they are right now please.

column10:
Please don't put the grades at the very end, it would be even more stressful, especially if we are not confident about a block. When the grades come gradually and we can see that we are failing a block, we have time to adapt our study plan.
The main problem are grades not coming fast enough I think.

column11: Releasing the grades as soon as possible, even if it is still during the exam session, and not have to wait until the end of the 3 weeks exam session

column5: You’re right, I’m always refreshing Is-Academia and it’s difficult to me to think about something else.

column10: Si les notes sont mises sur ISA une fois par jour, le serveur va être bloqué, comme pour les inscriptions au cours

column5: It is very stressful to feel the pressure that at anytime, family time, activity … a grade can come. And the fact that not everything is communicated at the same time, leaves so much anxiety when you have a bad grade. For me the February holidays are not holidays until I get all of my grades. I can’t enjoy knowing that at any moment my mood can switch.
Better than having to wait

column10: There should be a define date given prior to the exams of when the grades will be available if we were to receive them at the same time.
column11: Sometimes it takes time to understand the way the final grade is calculated due to the difference in importance of particular subjects (at least in CMS). Therefore, it would be great if we were provided with information on how the grade is calculated.

Instead of having one unique feedback day for all the grades, maybe the teacher could announce in advance the day he will post the grade. The same way we know we have an exam on the 16th of January, we could know that on the 22nd he/she will post the grades. That way it is a commitment directly from the teacher. Of course if for some reason there is a delay the teacher can always communicate with the class explaining why (transparency is the best solution as always :))
How about on the Monday of each week, or on a specific day of each week, because none of the proposed solutions ACTUALLY help reduce the anxiety that you could receive a grade any day

column5: You can't relax even durin holidays

column10: Si on devait recevoir toutes les notes en même temps, je trouve que ce serait la meilleure solution mais ça devrait être avant 3 semaines. Donc raccourcir ce temps-là.
column11: Une fois par semaine donc 3x sur la période après-examens.

What if each professors warns their class to expect their grades at a certain time a certain day so we can know when we will receive the grade and eventually not look when it is released if we don’t want to. In general, the correcting team knows when they will be finished with grading so they could warn us that « the grade is coming »

column10:
All of these things stress out no matter what, people can just deactivate EPFL campus notifications if they want to.
 Receiving all your grades at once is worse if you have terrible grades overall, receiving them progressively softens the blow at least. 
Receiving at a set time feels stressful too as you anticipate that time the entire day

column5: The app is always delayed. Maybe fixing that would make it less stressful than having all of your friends call you at the same time.

column12: Knowing that a course has been graded but the grade is not available yet, e.g. #### on IS-Academia makes me quite impatient. If there would be a fixed date for grades to be released, I would not want to know in advance when which course has given their grades.

column5: I don't stress about it but I check my phone to many times.

column11: Teachers announce in advance when they will release the grades

column5: i live having my day ruined by recieving a new grade while having my breakfast
column10:
i usually have recieved grades up to the very end and trues to not look until then, but i would have also liked to know what 
 grade was the notification about
column11:
1- see all your grades at once ONCE ALL ARE AVAILABLE
2- have the possibility to look at one specific grade only ( if i only want to see analyse 1 as soon as it drops for some reason i would like to be able to do that)-> have a 1st page with the name of the exam, a green/red box to see if it is available, click and then see for instance
column12: thank you for asking, it is an important subject. february break is the first real one since september, it is really anyoing to be thinking/stressed about school at that moment

column5: I think the current system is fine, maybe just give a deadline for when grades are to be handed in. So we at least know the maximum amount of time we will have to wait.
column10: Same as above

column5: It does not affect me personally, but I understand that it might greatly affect other people, so I think this discussion is very positive

I think that the current system is set up in a way that anyone can choose how he wants to receive his grades. For example, you can decide to turn off the notifications of the app or the notifications of the chat group and decide to check all your grades at the end if you want.
column10: I don’t think that the suggestions have anything wrong but I am not sure whether it is really that necessary

column11: It would be nice if the average of class is also displayed

column5: I often don't want to see the grades because it arrives unexpectedly
column10: Probably all grades at the same time is the most difficult option to be accepted by everyone, but also would induce overall less stress about the grades because of the waiting and receiving all the grades at once instead as one by one as soon as possible... Just sharing some thoughts
column11:
Removing the *** from the app and only putting the grades when appropriate
Do not leak anything (some people can know if they passed or failed an exam previously...)
column12: Thank you for changing this stressing part of the system if possible

column10: I think that the only stressful time is when you know it's gonna drop "soon", like when the teacher say "the grades will be up on day x" because then it's going to be a reload festival until we get the grade. So I think that if they don't say anything the system we have now works best, but if they annonce the date then a fixed release hour may be better

column5: this is also the case for assignments that we submitted during the semester for which we didn't receive any feedback or grade, it's stressful not to know how we succeeded our assignment or review before the end of the semester.

The fact that the notification can show up at any moment is very stressful and makes me very anxious , I think it would be beteer if all the grades are released at once or something at a certain time communicated before.

column11: Maybe updating the results once a week is sufficient

column5: C’est un suspens insupportable, au lieu de profiter de nos vrais jours de vacance on regarde toutes les heures is-academia pour voir puis une fois qu’on en a une on calcule les autres pour voir si ça va passer ou pas puis à chaque nouvelle note ça remet en question la réussite Je vois bien que les gens qui sont sûr de passer ça ne les inquiète pas vraiment mais personnellement je suis souvent à la limite et jusqu’au dernier moment je fais mes moyennes pour savoir les notes que je dois obtenir… Même par rapport à l’annonce aux parents, j’annonce à chaque fois mes notes et eux restent un peu dans l’incompréhension aussi jusqu’au moment où je leur annonce que c’est bon ou pas.
column11: On doit souvent attendre d’avoir payer notre frac pour avoir accès à nos attestations d’études qui elles montrent bien qu’on passe ou pas mais en attendant on reçoit juste nos notes et on doit calculer et parfois j’ai très peur d’avoir mal calculer ou de mettre tromper de coeff pour une note etc donc je me dis que ce serait chouette d’avoir un papier un mail ou même un message qui annonce qu’on a réussi ou rater le semestre
column12: Merci beaucoup d’essayer de faire changer ça !

column5:
I prefer to have the results as soon as possible. I think that this the best option as those who doesn't want to receive them like that may disable the app notification and watch them when they want on isa and for those who want to receive them immediatly can use the app notif.

One of the change that may be implemented is to have a hard deadline (closer than the current one, all exam are out much before) where students know for sure that they have their results.
column10: In my opinion, I don't like the option of receiving all grades at the same time because I think it is up to the student responsability to check or not the notification.
column11:
One idea that could be great would be to write on the pocket campus notification the subject of which you receive the result. Indeed for touchy subject the student my delay the action of opening it. 
Also it helps for these student to avoid or not the chat group knowing which subject is going to be discussed

column5: But a good feeling  this is excitment
column10: Because now we are not waiting for this fixed so less in our mind

column11: Professors could choose and communicate themselves a date and time to publish the grades shortly after the exam session (even if this means that the grades might be published a few days after the completion of grading).

More flexibility and transparency regarding the grading process: making papers available for review easily, provide a detailed correction for all interested students (alongside marks distribution), extend the appeal time to two months.
column12: Today’s format needs to be fixed, I have the impression that I’ll go insane while waiting for my results!

column10: I personally find it even more stressful to have to wait for a fixed date where everything would be released. I like it better that we have them as soon as we can.
One that would like to have push notifications once a day, can simply disable the notifications and check the app whenever they want.

Devoir attendre la deadline de rendu des notes pour toute les recevoir en même temps ne ferrait qu'allonger l'attente et le stress lié aux résultats. Certaines personnes préfères sans doute voir toutes leurs notes en même temps mais je pense également qu'elles souhaiteraient les avoir le plus rapidement possible.
With a fixed date if it’s possible

column5: Je ne pense pas être représentatif de la majorité pour le stress
column10: Pocket à heure fixe sans toucher à ISA me semble absurde: ça rend les choses encore plus compliquées sans vraiment changer le niveau de stress (les gens cont continuer à refresh ISA et fuir telegram).
column11: les notes arrivent à jour & heure fixe,  p.ex. tous les lundis 15h pour telle section

column5: j'ai désactivé les notifications, et de toutes façon les gens dans les groupes de promo sont plus réactifs que l'app
column10: le problème de tout recevoir en même temps, c'est qu'il y a toujours des profs qui rendent les notes en retard. Est-ce que dans cette situation ça bloquerait la publication des autres notes?

column5: Ça met pas mal de stress pendant les vacances, alors que c'est sensé être un moment pour décompresser
column11: On pourrait aussi faire des réceptions à heures fixes mais tous les 2-3 jours (histoire d'avoir des jours où on sait que rien ne va tomber)
column12: C'est cool que vous réfléchissiez là dessus :)

column10:
Je trouve que la dernière proposition est la plus intéressante, mais par bloc plutôt que toutes les notes en même temps!
I.e. dès que toutes les notes d’un bloc sont sorties, sortir l’ensemble des notes des matières constituant un bloc. Cela donnerait en 1ère année de bachelor (je parle pour MA) deux sorties de notes, en 2ème année une seule sortie (+ SHS), puis en 3ème année chaque note sortant individuellement (ne changerait rien).
Car au final c’est la réussite ou non des blocs qui déterminent la réussite ou non!
column11: Cf. Commentaire précédent
Peut être une notification de pocket campus informant de nouvelles notes?

column10: Si c'est une fois par jour sur pocket campus, quelqu'un va forcement envoyer un message sur le groupe de section lorsque la note sera sur IS-Academia

column5: Pas encore recu de notes comme ca donc jsp
column10: Je suis pas qqun d anxieux pour ce genre de choses

column5: Actualisation fréquente de la page des résultats
column11: Opt-in / Opt-out

column10: Surtout pas toute les notes en même temps, ce serait beaucoup trop long d’attendre de tout avoir, je préfère définitivement les avoir des qu’elle sorte (ou presque avec le système à heure fixe)

column5: Notamment pour les cours avec un seul examen final
column11: Mieux communiquer sur les dates de réception des notes serait déjà une grande avancée

column5: On aimerait juste les recevoir plus tôt, ça traîne beaucoup la plupart du temps et on a pas toujours le détail des notes (des homeworks par exemple)
Je passe en général jusqu'à 3-4 fois par jour sur isa ou l'appli vérifier si une nouvelle note est sortie.

column10: Le fait de recevoir toutes les notes en même temps est selon moi un gros point positif. Notamment au niveau du stress engendré, recevoir tout d’un coup implique une unique notification et un résultat immédiat sur la réussite ou pas du semestre et des blocs. Réduisant ainsi considérablement l’anxiété créée par les notifications arrivant petit à petit et l’attente de notes potentiellement décisives.
